info.title: V2C Thirdparty API
info.description:
# Introduction
This is the V2C RESTful API (Application Programming Interface), which facilitates interaction with V2C's web services. It enables **remote control of charging devices**, **management of RFID credentials**, **retrieval of charging statistics**, and **configuration of specific device parameters**.

This API allows you to integrate your e-Charger with self-developed applications or services, enabling the creation of custom automations and advanced functionalities for your charging points.

# Authentication
The API uses a Bearer Token (API Key) for authentication. You must provide your personal token in the custom header **`apikey`** with every request. If the `apikey` is invalid or missing, the API will return a **`401 Unauthorized`** error.

## How to obtain your API Key
To obtain your authentication token, log in to **v2c.cloud**, navigate to the **API** section in the left-hand menu, and generate your key.

For more information, visit: https://v2charge.com/support/v2c-cloud/get-token-id-api-rest-cloud/

# Rate Limiting
Each user is subject to a rate limit of **1000 daily calls** (requests). Should you require a higher volume of calls, please contact V2C technical support.

All successful responses will include the following headers for usage monitoring:

* **`RateLimit-Limit`**: The maximum number of requests allowed in the daily period (e.g., 1000).
* **`RateLimit-Remaining`**: The number of requests remaining in the current daily period.

tags.name: Device Control & Configuration
tags.description: Commands to remotely control and configure the core charging behavior and settings of devices (POST Actions).

tags.name: Device Status & Data Retrieval
tags.description: Queries to obtain the current operational state and diagnostic data from the device (GET Queries).

tags.name: RFID Management
tags.description: Administration of RFID cards, including registration, removal, and reader control.

tags.name: Charging Statistics
tags.description: Retrieval of aggregated and session-specific data for charging history.

tags.name: Advanced Power Profiles
tags.description: Management of personalized power configurations (e.g., Solar Mode profiles).

tags.name: Firmware Management
tags.description: Management and query of the device's firmware version.

tags.name: Pairing Management
tags.description: Management of device pairings associated with the user account.

post.description: Initiates or resumes the charging session on the specified device.
Pauses the current charging session on the specified device.
Updates the maximum charging current (in Amperes) allowed for the session.
Locks or unlocks the charging point access. 0: Unlock, 1: Lock.
Enables or disables dynamic power control (load balancing). 0: Dynamic Off, 1: Dynamic On.
Updates the photovoltaic charging mode. 0: PV + Minimum Power, 1: Exclusive PV, 2: Maximum Power.
Updates the maximum power (in Watts) allowed for the entire electrical installation.
Updates the maximum charging current (in Amperes) that the connected electric vehicle (EV) can accept.
Updates the minimum charging current (in Amperes) that the connected electric vehicle (EV) requires to charge.
Configures the device to automatically stop charging after a specific amount of energy (in kWh) has been delivered.
Configures the device to automatically stop charging after a specific duration (in minutes).
Starts a charging session that is scheduled to stop after delivering a specified amount of energy (in kWh).
Starts a charging session that is scheduled to stop after a specified number of minutes.
Configures a start/end time timer (timerId) on the device for scheduled charging.
Updates the electrical installation type. 0: Monophase, 1: Three-phase, 2: Photovoltaic.
Activates or deactivates the Open Charge Point Protocol (OCPP) functionality. 0: OCPP Off, 1: OCPP On.
Configures the unique Charge Point Identifier for OCPP communication.
Configures the endpoint URL for the central OCPP server.
Configures the IP address of the connected solar inverter (e.g., Huawei).
Updates the device's WiFi network credentials (SSID and Password).
Updates the connected energy meter (slave) type for load balancing. 0: Shelly, 1: V2C v2, 3: Huawei, 4: Solax, etc.
Changes the device's display language. Values include 0: English, 1: Spanish, 2: Portuguese, etc.
Turns the device's logo LED light on or off.
Executes a remote reboot command on the device.
Retrieves the device's comprehensive operational data, including charging status, power metrics, and error codes.

200.description: Command executed successfully. Returns device's real-time charging status.

get.description: Gets the last known status and data reported by the device (the "shadow" state). This is the most comprehensive data endpoint.
Checks if the device is currently connected to the V2C Cloud service.
Sends a command to the device to scan and return a list of all visible WiFi networks in its vicinity.

post.description: Puts the device into a learning state to read and register a new physical RFID card.

delete.summary: Delete Registered RFID Card by Code
delete.description: Deletes an RFID card from the device's whitelist using its unique code (UID).

get.description: Gets the list of all RFID cards currently registered on the device.

post.description: Manually adds an RFID card to the device's whitelist by specifying its code (UID) and a name (tag).

put.description: Updates the friendly name (tag) associated with an existing registered RFID card code.

post.description: Activates or deactivates the physical RFID reader functionality on the device. 0: Reader Off, 1: Reader On.

get.description: Gets the last 5 charging statistics for a specific device, with optional filtering by date range.
Gets aggregated (global) charging statistics for all devices associated with the authenticated user, optionally filtered by date range.

post.description: Creates and saves a new personalized power configuration profile.
Updates an existing personalized power configuration profile.

get.description: Retrieves a single personalized power configuration profile using its timestamp.

delete.description: Deletes a personalized power configuration profile by its name and timestamp.

get.description: Gets a list of all personalized power configuration profiles associated with the device.

post.description: Sends a command to the device to search for and install the latest available firmware update.

get.description: Gets the current firmware version string of the specified device.
Gets the list of all device pairings associated with the authenticated user.

apiKeyAuth.name: apikey
apiKeyAuth.description: Personal API Key required for authentication, obtained from the V2C user portal.

CurrentStateChargeResponse.description: Real-time operational data and status of the device during a charging session.

error.description: Error code or message if dynamic control reports a fault. An empty string indicates no current error.

battery.description: Battery value reported by the dynamic control system.

seconds.description: Duration of the current charging session in seconds.

photovoltaic_on.description: Status of the Photovoltaic (PV) charging mode. 0-> Off, 1->On.

charge_state.description: Current state of the charging process.

power.description: Power currently delivered to the vehicle (kW).

sun_power.description: Power reported from the solar panels (kW).

phases.description: Number of phases currently used for charging (1 or 3).

energy.description: Total energy delivered in the current charging session (kWh).

TimerDTO.description: Data structure for programming a charging timer on the device.

PersonalPower.description: Model for an Advanced Power Profile configuration.

Statistic.description: Detailed statistics for a single charging session. Returns the last 5 sessions if no date range is specified.

id.description: Unique identifier for the charging record.

startChargeDate.description: Date and time when the charging session began.

endChargeDate.description: Date and time when the charging session ended.

idCharge.description: Secondary identifier for the charge session (often a formatted timestamp).

energy.description: Total energy consumed during the session (kWh).

cost.description: Total monetary cost of the charge session.

coCost.description: Cost associated with CO2 (carbon offset cost).

costFv.description: Monetary cost covered by Photovoltaic (FV) energy.

energyByHour.description: Energy consumed per hour, usually represented as a pipe-separated string (e.g., '0.9|3.5|3.6|1.6').

energyByHourFv.description: Energy provided by Photovoltaic (FV) per hour. Null if no FV data is available.

rfidCode.description: Unique code (UID) of the RFID card used to start the charge.

rfidName.description: Friendly name associated with the RFID card used.

warning.description: Indicates if a warning was registered during the session.

finished.description: Indicates if the session finished correctly.

createdAt.description: Record creation timestamp on the cloud server.

updatedAt.description: Record last update timestamp on the cloud server.

GlobalStadisticInfo.description: Aggregated charging statistics across multiple devices or a period.
